    plotMutTree plots phylogenetic tree of mutations

    plotMutTree.Rd

    plotMutTree plots phylogenetic tree of mutations

    Usage

    plotMutTree(
  maf,
  patient.id,
  method = "NJ",
  min.vaf = 0.02,
  bootstrap.rep.num = 500,
  group = NULL,
  group.colors = NULL,
  title = "cancer",
  hexpand_ratio = 0.3,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    maf

    Maf or MafList object generated by readMaf function.

    patient.id

    Select the specific patients.

    method

    Approach to construct phylogenetic trees. Choose one of "NJ"(Neibor-Joining), "MP"(maximum parsimony), "ML"(maximum likelihood), "FASTME.ols" or "FASTME.bal".

    min.vaf

    The minimum value of vaf. Default 0.

    bootstrap.rep.num

    Bootstrap iterations. Default 500.

    group

    a list that used to indicate the sample groups

    group.colors

    an array indicates the colors of sample groups.

    title

    title of the plot.

    ...

    parameters in the getPhyloTree function.

    hexpand_ratio:

    hexpand ratio. see hexpand

    Examples

    library(MesKit)
data.type <- "split1"

maf <- readMaf(
  mafFile = system.file(package = "MPTevol", "extdata", sprintf("meskit.%s.mutation.txt", data.type)),
  ccfFile = system.file(package = "MPTevol", "extdata", sprintf("meskit.%s.CCF.txt", data.type)),
  clinicalFile = system.file(package = "MPTevol", "extdata", sprintf("meskit.%s.clinical.txt", data.type)),
  refBuild = "hg19",
  ccf.conf.level = 0.95
)

# construct a group
group <- list(
  Coad = paste0("Coad_", 1:5),
  OveryLM = paste0("OveryLM_", 1:5),
  OveryRM = paste0("OveryRM_", 1:6),
  UterusM = paste0("UterusM_", c(1, 3))
)

plotMutTree(maf, patient.id = "Met1", group = group, title = "CRC Met")
